review: We had a lovely dinner tonight with our kiddos. Our server, Chris, was super nice--attentive without being pesky, and friendly without being manic.  It was pretty busy, but we didn't have to wait long, and the service was very fast. The restaurant was also very clean. I can't really comment on the food...standard American restaurant fare, I didn't have to cook, and I don't have food poisoning, so: win!

This is one of the worst places I've eaten at in the last year.  I used to be a loyal customer,  but the food was never great. However,  over the last year it's gotten pretty bad.   The service in Olympia isn't so bad.  The food is, other than the grilled asparagus.  Steaks are over cooked; a medium well came out past well done, and a medium came out well done on the verge of being well done. The mashed potatoes are are rubbery.  The appetizers are much smaller than they used to be,  and rubbery.  The only thing good about applebees is the perfect margarita.  I will not be visiting here again to choke down less than McDonalds quality food. If it's not obvious,  that was an insult.  Good luck staying in business in towns with more than 5 restaurants.
Drew was an amazing server! Super friendly and advocated for the a1 sauce which was super fun to eat
Customer Service is prompt, the food is great especially at a happy hour price.  I usually am seated right away even while the restaurant is busy! Energetic and welcoming staff

Last night my fiancé and I went in for dinner a few minutes before happy hour. We were bummed we couldn't do the half off appetizers but we did find another deal which was 2 entree plus an appetizer for $22 and immediately ordered that. The server was alright but the manager was excellent on handling our order since I had some minor issues with my pasta being barely any coating of sauce... it tasted like boiled pasta out of the microwave with shaved cheese on top. The manager's name is Victor and he exceeded out of his way to make us satisfied, the server, ehhhh, not so really... I would have this review a two stars but Victor deserves five stars for his awesome service and providing us positive attitude! I probably won't be returning due to the lack of customer service from some of those servers but I would be returning to a different Applebee's around town, maybe in Lacey!

his food perfect, chicken succulent tender, done right. I ordered steak medium rare, and steak arrived well F@$&)_* done and literally chewed through!! Like this piece of meat went through broiling, heat lamp, and microwave. funny to f&*()&*( with customer's food, and funny when customer leaves honest review. Larry Chris. never came to see how we liked our food, and waited for Larry Chris. to do his job.  I walk to kitchen for assistance I am not eating this piece of rubber presented in front of me unacceptable. Walked to kitchen carrying rawhide *yummy*. The manager who stops me midway, and asks, "What's wrong?"  I point at *steak* not medium rare. 20 minutes later I am presented with a perfect steak, but service lacked we did not see Manager or waiter again. Steak meal comped, but would not step foot in again due to customer service.

This place rocks!!!! Every time! Their selection is incredible, and the food is consistently great! My boyfriend and I have tried many different entrees and apps. One of our favorite appetizers is the Siracha Shrimp! The burgers are a little messy, but packed with flavor. Last visit I had the pulled pork tacos, which were amazing! There is so much to choose from! However, What really makes the experience is the service. We have visited this location 8 or so times, and have never received poor service. That alone says something for a restaurant. Genesis, or waitress the other evening, is truly phenomenal. She is so genuine and knowledgeable. She represents the establishment enthusiastically, and really makes us feel welcomed and comfortable every time . She possess an upbeat and professional demeanor which is so very rare. She is absolutely impressive and a true gem!!!! We can't wait to go back!  Thank you Genesis!!!

I ordered the new Southwestern steak salad, it's surprisingly small portion of the sirloin steak, so tiny like it's kids meal. The salad part was fine, huge difference from the advertised picture. It's deceiving! Very disappointed! My server was okay, although she disappeared after taking my food order, I couldn't find her to order a drink, looked around and the managers were happily having conversations at the bar with other servers, saw my wondering looks but no response!!!!!  I shouldn't have come.

Had Andrew as a bartender, he's a great conversationalist, pays great attention to detail, kept the beers coming, was super attentive to all tables and really knew his stuff. Definitely coming back again

We stop here every year on our way home to Vancouver WA. from a Seahawks game. Their service is always excellent with their amazing food and drinks. Monique and the staff make us feel like we are all family. We had the 2 for $25.I had the Bourbon Street Chicken + Shrimp! OMG it was the best flavor, so tender and delicious. I was able to bring 1/2 of it home so will have for lunch today. We shared the Spinach and Artichoke dip and we both loved it.!! The drinks are always amazing.  Thank you Monique, we will see you again next fall!

Great place to chill and have a beer. I honestly like Applebee's because it's one of the only places in Olympia that's open later every night. They are open till midnight most nights. And with half price apps, it can't be beat! And the late night staff are also awesome.
The food and service here was great compared to other locations. I'm sure we'll be back. Bathroom was clean. Restaurant looked clean. Waitress was friendly and kept our cups filled.

Great location. Food was great but could have been hotter. PLEASE APPLEBEES.  WHEN SOMEONE ORDERS ANYTHING ON A SKILLET... CAN IT PLEASE SIZZLE WHEN YOU BRI G IT OUT...  that's part of the joy of eating t.  A This place is better than the one I frequented in o.c.  that place sucked a$$.   Servers could be a little less awkward.

So first time at this Applebee's and we got our drinks and was checked on once and then sat for 10 minutes after telling the waitress we needed a minute. We kept staring the guy down and no one ever came back so me and my boyfriend walked out. Didn't want to wait forever to try and get some food.
Great place to take the family! Our nieces made the choice. Food was great and excellent customer service.

We've eaten here on several occasions and most of the time, the food and service is great. A couple of weeks ago, we ordered takeout and I found several long dark hairs in my mashed potatoes. There were these same hairs in the green beans. That was straight up nasty. I ended up throwing my food away. I ordered a steak as well and requested it well done. I received it BARELY medium well. There was still a lot of pink in it. I basically couldn't eat any of it.  This was the only time I've had issues with the food here, but for me, it's a big deal to have hair in the food. That's just gross. Probably won't be back.
This place deserves a few more stars just because the waitstaff is so damn nice. I have never been treated poorly or unfairly here, and that's saying something living in Olympia.
Very nice place for a casual dinner. Great food. The staff are outstanding. Miss Sarah S. Was a attentive & a professional. Also very kind and funny!

Had the lunch combo with shrimp scampi and the chicken 7 cheese Mac & cheese. It was wonderful.  Great taste.  The combo lunch meals. This is great concept. There are  a large number of combinations of salads soups and entrees.  The service was excellent from Fernanda our waitress.  Will be back to try another combination.   The place is clean and well decorated making the eating experience very enjoyable.

Service - was a little slow on a Friday night. One thing I was surprised to see was that the waitress (who brought the ice drinks) just sprayed the ice cubes across the floor from her tray after delivering our drinks. They must have been ice cubes that were left on her tray but I was really surprised at her manner to have left ice cubes everywhere where customers could have stepped and slipped on them..  Food - I had the ribs and it was well cooked, but the sauce was a little salty. The Caesar salad was decently fresh vegetables but the dressing made the lettuce a little matted. The cheese potatoes and broccoli sides were yummy and went well with the ribs. Ingredients could be fresher, but overall was decent quality food.

I have come to the conclusion that Applebee's has fallen on hard times. Service is really not up to par, and the quality of their appetizers leave a fair bit to be desired.  Couple all of this with a happy hour that isn't worth coming in for, in terms of value.  The bartender, N. W. seems more preoccupied with inviting patrons who are regulars to a party at her house than with paying attention to the rest of the bar. She could also learn to practice some discretion by controlling the volume of her voice.  And, make sure you ask for the check very clearly, because even with the bar emptying out, it is a hell of an ordeal getting a check.  Then again, I think our bartender needs to take up a career in party planning, rather than bartending.
The beer is pricey but the waitresses are always very friendly and the food is great too . Love the music and the set up of the restaurant .

My husband & I just went here for dinner at 5:15 pm. We were served a small salad at 5:45. We kept noticing people coming in & getting their food, so we asked our server how long will it be (it was 6:30). She said the cooks were slow & nothing else was said . I got home & called to talk to manager. After waiting 3 min. a person answered & I explained what happened. He said he wasn't manager & that they were very busy. I had told him how other people were eating after we'd been there for over an hour. I ended up hanging up on the brainless person. Never going back.

Such a nice waitress, she bent over backwards to accommodate my dietary needs!    Our table of six all ordered the 8 oz Sirloin with varying sides... after our orders went to the kitchen, our waitress informed us that they were out of 8oz steaks but only had 6 or 13 oz available...we all agreed on the 6 oz steaks....!   The broccoli listed as 'steamed' broccoli, unlike the garlic green beans, so I. Asked if it was plain, the waitress explained that it had butter and garlic on it... but that she could get 'Childs broccoli ', which would be plain.    When my dish came, broccoli was dripping with butter,  I asked to make sure--- they came and took it away!   As we were settling our checks, the waitress informed us that our meager steaks were indeed 8 oz not 6 oz and we would be charged accordingly!   Humph!!!
I'm giving a 4 star only because they no longer offer riblets!!!! Right!!! But their food is still delish even with the new menu items! And I recomend you eat here!!!

Great service and good food. I got the macaroni and cheese. Best thing they have I think. The artichoke dip was good as well. Even comes with a little salsa! Best part was that they were packed but still were very fast. Love this place!

3.5 star to be exact. I like Applebees and it's fun coming once in awhile. I was pescatarian for awhile so I was really into eating seafood when I ate out. They don't have a great seafood selection. I think most of their food is pretty good, but honestly I would rather go next door to the Olive Garden where I can pick from unlimited salad or soup, and those mouth watering breadsticks... yumm. I took a bite out of my bf's burger though and it tasted pretty bomb.. chyeah. Monday night's are the night to get your special burger price from this place. Super awesome deal.

The food was good but the service was pretty bad.  The waiter brought our food and asked if we wanted anything else. I said "Yes, silverware?"  He then immediately went to the next table to take their order. I watched him then go to the back of the room and do something there for a while. I assumed he was putting together some silverware. But then he walked to the back room out of sight. I waited a while longer then walked to the bar to ask for silverware from the bartender rather than stare at our food any longer.  She apologized. When he finally came back, without any silverware, I might add, he said "Oh, who got you silverware?"  I told him I'd gotten it myself and all he had to say for himself was "Oh". Here's a suggestion - how about "I'm sorry"?

Went on a slow night. Seated ourself at the bar tables. Manager came by and got our drinks started, said the waiter would be by soon... he never came by, manager came back and took our order. 5 minutes after that the waiter came by and asked if we ordered.. didn't receive our food for another 15 minutes. Some of it was cold. Not the first time we've had bad/slow service here.

I use to always come here for my steaks! They were so good and flavorful! But I just went tonight and was devastated to find out that they had changed the way they make cuts and that had influenced the taste. No lie it looked like a burger patty from McDonald's pale and no flavor. I asked for my money back. Not planning on coming back.

The day after eating here, my whole family got sick.  I contacted headquarters and within 2 hours, the manager contacted me personally.  He was concerned, helpful and kind.  He sent me certificates for another meal and said that he would report this issue to the health department himself.  That is why I changed my stars to 3.  The food flavor was really really bad but hey, at least they care about what their customers think and feel even after they leave the establishment.
The atmosphere and service is fantastic, but the food was lacking in flavor and portion, but this probably goes for this chain as a whole.

First time visit at this location for brunch with family and friends.  We arrived soon after they opened and seated immediately.  Our server was new to Applebees and let us know, but did very well and was very attentive and personable.   I ordered hot tea and noticed that the metal tea pot thing was a little crusty on the buttom.  I took the spoon and scraped the bottom and some residue dislodged and floated in the water. I didn't drink it. Thankfully I was given a mug of hot water in addition to the tea pot so all was well in the tea enjoyment experience aside from the crusty pot.  I was also given a wedge of lemon, packet of honey, and spoon with my tea which was nice.   I ordered the biscuits and gravy meal. It didn't take long for our orders to be ready and the eggs were nicely cooked to order.  Yum! The meal was altogether savory and filling. The biscuits were a bit hard on the outside but the insides were soft.  The ample gravy helped soften the outer part of the biscuits. Yum nonetheless. The sausage was chewy, maybe a little overcooked, but I prefer that vs undercooked.  I'll definitely come back again for breakfast and brunch. Service and food was pretty darn good. I also liked arriving soon after they open, it's quiet and calm and quick service. FYI, not too far from Interstate 5 (I-5).
Family fun night playing Disney trivia and the server is pushing spooky drinks on us. I'm drunk woo

Very disappointed tonight it took 15 minutes after we ordered to find out they were out of the crispy chicken.  Then I got very thin (thick) cut pork chop it looked like they put a brick on it.  Disappointed tonight with this trip!  Update manager checked in and she will be working to improve the situation and provided us a gift certificate we will be back again!  Thank you!

Lots of menu options (even some lo-cal that are really tasty!), good consistency and actually really great service, in my experience. I like to sit in the bar for a bit better atmosphere. The Green Bean Crispers appetizer is DELICIOUS, if you're into that sort of thing (I am, and how). Ditto the won-ton taco appetizer, and pub pretzel sticks.  The fries are usually over-salted. I put copious amounts of salt on most things, and I don't need to salt the fries here. That's pretty unheard of for me, so I am just going to assume that some people would be a bit displeased with them. They changed the French Onion Soup recipe about a year or so ago, and it's definitely not as good as it once was.  I also mysteriously never seem tempted by any of their desserts...everything seems to be some combination of ice cream and/or chocolate - 2 things this Martian isn't that excited by. Chain food is not always bad food, sometimes you just want the same thing you've had before, the same way you had it then. You can get that here.
We ordered 2 margaritas for happy hour and were charged $18..
went there for the new Wood Fired Grill I ordered medium-rare the first steaks way overcooked took another 10 minutes to get my steak and that one wasn't medium rare my wife besides I'm eating

Slow service..inattentive server, pretty sure we'll never come back to here.  Had a pretty bad experience at this location. months later we still have no desire for Applebees. Not overly impressed with the menu, prices are generally higher than what I would expect to pay. And the service at this location was just horrendous.
Ordered the chicken quesadilla and immediately after returning back to my hotel, I was sick to my stomach. For 2 whole days, I was unable to keep my food down. Stay away if you don't want to be sick!

Curtis was our server tonight, the exemplary service he provided right off the bat set the tone for the night! We got our food in a good amount of time and our specifications were all met. Will 100% return when home boy Curtis is working.

I have in the past had horrible service at Applebee's, so I didn't go there for several years because of it.  I decided to give them another chance and was very happy with the service I received!  They were friendly and attentive, food was good.  They have redeemed themselves for me and I will most likely be going back.
Low-calorie meals shouldn't mean low portions!!  Last I checked, Romain lettuce doesn't cost that much.  $11 for the portion of a two-year old!!!

Excellent steaks, attentive service and REALLY good prices. Came here on a Friday night, they very busy but we were able to get a seat in the bar right away. Decided on the 2 for $20 deal, and both ended up ordering the same thing: sirloin steak with mashed potatoes and vegetables. Shared the buffalo chicken "wings", which were the only "eh" part of the meal. Weren't terrible, but wouldn't order again. The steaks were PERFECT, tender and juicy. Vegetables were cooked well but bland and could have been fresher. Not bad though. All the wait staff were very friendly and attentive, really awesome service.  Only complaints: Upon being served, waitress asked us to slice into our steaks to check if done to our liking. Although it was nice of her to make sure, this resulted in a lot of juices running from the steaks. :( Would have preferred to let it rest a minute first, but didn't want to refuse the request. Seems like this  practice is Applebee's policy, should be reconsidered in my opinion. Girlfriend wanted a beer, but selection was limited. Do people actually drink Coors? 0_o Anyways, she went with a Pyramid Haywire which ended up costing $5.50!? Way too pricey for a mediocre beer, will definitely hit happy hour or skip beverages next time. Overall, the service, really yummy food, and great value mean we will definitely be back. :)
Average food. Very friendly and welcoming staff. Social atmosphere. Pretty efficient, but uneven at times.

We had a late lunch (1:30-2:00 pm) on Tuesday Jan. 19,2016 the restaurant was not busy so we got good service and the high-lite of the meal was the really hot, hot platters the sirloin steak was served on I ordered rare and it was a little tough my husband order med. rare and his was wonderful. Two things turned a great meal into a bad experience at this restaurant. There is a computer contraption on the table which the waitress was showing us how to look at the desserts so while waiting for our food we were messing around with this thing only to find out when we got the bill there was a $2.00 (that's right Two Dollars) charge for using this thing. These either need a very large notice that there is a charge for touching or remove them from the table. Talk about a sting that surely was one. The cheese cake banana cracker jack thumbs down.

Well I just had a great experience, I went in for the endless ribs and they were really good (I liked the asian sauce the most). The servers were awesome, always getting us napkins, sauces, filling drinks, and just making sure we were okay. Once I got done my first plate of ribs they had a second one at the table. Props to this Applebee's, they really worked together and made our experience fantastic. I am definitely going to applebee's again, most likely for their late night happy hour.

I have been going to this Applebee's for well over 2 years now.  It used to be great you walk in get a seat relatively quick and service with a smile and they were always willing to wrk with you.  What true service should be.  I don't know if this place is under new management or they just don't care anymore, but I had my worst experience in a restaurant that I have ever had yesterday.   First they could find a place for us to get service.  Mind you that it was just me and my wife.  Then the beat they could come up with was for us to sit in the bar area.  So we take a seat get comfortable and her come the bar tender to take our order.  She ask for our ID.  My wire is in her mid thirties and I am in my mid forties.  My wife did not have her ID and they said they had to move us because it was policy to ask for an ID.  Oh we were not ordering drinks either just food.  Then we moved and sat there for around 5 to 10 minutes in a restaurant that was dang near empty and not one server came to the table.  The bar tender could have work with us a talked to a manager to make an exception but instead they wanted to inconvenience the customer.  So we left went next door to the Olive Garden and receive the service that everyone should get when going to a restaurant.  I will not go to this Applebee's again.

Stopped in for dinner. The place was packed and we got in really quickly even with a party of 6. The food came out piping hot and was very tasty. There are several restaurants in the area but we choose this place because of the short wait.  Next time I'm in this area I will stop here again.

Just your average Applebee's, not as busy as the one in Lacey. Prices are decent enough, alcohol prices only worth it during happy hour. Happy hour also brings selected half price appetizers! And the 2 for 20 deal isn't too bad either. Long story short...  it's way more fun if you sit at the bar.
Genesis is fantastic! So fun and great to interact with. She treated us (a table of cackling 20 y/o's) with respect and humor!

The best Applebee's I've been to! The food was so good and so was the service! Everyone was wry friendly and I liked how the manager actually took time to stop by every table and make sure things were good. Since the remodel, the place looks fresher and nicer!

I used to love Applebee's....when I was a kid. I came here for a kid's b-day party and even though we had a large group, they seated us and waited on us very quickly. The reason why my review is so low is the food. It seems like everything served here comes out of a bag or can and NOTHING is fresh. I seriously can't imagine how much preservatives and high fructose corn syrup is in their food.  They do have a great dinner deal for two people where you share an appetizer and each get an entree for $20. We tried their buffalo wings, which were 99% breading and 1% chicken so it tasted like a bread ball drenched in buffalo sauce. Eh gross. The entree selections were dominated by shrimp, which I am allergic to so that eliminated 5 of the 8 possibilities for me. We ended up trying the riblet basket and the oriental chicken salad. The salad hardly had any lettuce, and was mostly dried noodles and almonds. Weird, and gross. The riblets were good. The BBQ sauce was alright, and overall it was OK. They were having happy hour, which is a pretty good deal. I had a hurricane and it was very strong and delish for only $5. I needed all of that booze to get me through the crap food. Overall the service is great, but the food is gross. I ended up paying for it later that day.

Waiter was great and attentive, but the food was just off -- fajitas overseasoned; jalapeños on burger were sweet (never had that before); a special order of fajitas (without meat) came half-size (you'd think they'd give extra veggies); and it took way too long to arrive.  Just stick to simple food and read the menu carefully and maybe you'll be alright.

I imbibed the mack m jacks which came in a particularly frosty glass, it also had a excellent head. As far as food goes I ordered the bourbon street chicken n shrimp the flavors where pleasing to my palate though the chicken was a bit dry.

My husband and I went there yesterday afternoon for lunch. We were startled by the hostess who opened the door for us. I would rather do that myself. She asked if we wanted to be seated at the bar. We chose our own table. The service was less than I expected. The food was also less than I expected. my husband 's club sandwich was sloppy and did not look like a club sandwich. No choices for vegetarians and the food all looked like it came out of a package. The coffee was terrible. Overpriced and under served and we will not be back. We had to wait too long for our check as it was not very busy.
